content.raw:
Looking into this now.

Is the `dtypeslist2dict` function necessary? As far as I can tell, the `[(name1, format1), (name2, format2)]` way of specifying a compound datatype continues to work in Python 3 as-is, is there a reason to change it to the dictionary way of specifying a datatype?
content.html:
Looking into this now.

Is the dtypeslist2dict function necessary? As far as I can tell, the [(name1, format1), (name2, format2)] way of specifying a compound datatype continues to work in Python 3 as-is, is there a reason to change it to the dictionary way of specifying a datatype?
